bug.author: the-lay
bug.summary: wandb fails on CUDA 8 and python3
bug.description:
Weights and Biases version: 0.8.9 (according to pip) Python version: 3.7.1 Operating System: linux
<denchmark-h:h3>Description</denchmark-h>
During any action with wandb, it fails on import (SyntaxError). This happens both in any script or any CLI action. We are running CUDA 8.0, and I guess pynvml that is being imported doesn't support python3. Here's CUDA version: <denchmark-code>> nvcc --version nvcc: NVIDIA (R) Cuda compiler driver Copyright (c) 2005-2016 NVIDIA Corporation Built on Tue_Jan_10_13:22:03_CST_2017 Cuda compilation tools, release 8.0, V8.0.61 </denchmark-code>
Traceback on wandb import: <denchmark-code>> python3 main.py Traceback (most recent call last): File "main.py", line 8, in <module> import wandb File "/home/username/.local/lib/python3.7/site-packages/wandb/__init__.py", line 42, in <module> from wandb.apis import InternalApi, PublicApi, CommError File "/home/username/.local/lib/python3.7/site-packages/wandb/apis/__init__.py", line 95, in <module> from .public import Api as PublicApi File "/home/username/.local/lib/python3.7/site-packages/wandb/apis/public.py", line 21, in <module> from wandb.summary import HTTPSummary, download_h5 File "/home/username/.local/lib/python3.7/site-packages/wandb/summary.py", line 15, in <module> from wandb.meta import Meta File "/home/username/.local/lib/python3.7/site-packages/wandb/meta.py", line 6, in <module> import pynvml File "/cm/local/apps/cuda/libs/current/pynvml/pynvml.py", line 1671 print c_count.value ^ SyntaxError: Missing parentheses in call to 'print'. Did you mean print(c_count.value)? </denchmark-code>
Traceback on CLI usage: <denchmark-code>> wandb Traceback (most recent call last): File "/home/username/.local/bin/wandb", line 7, in <module> from wandb.cli import cli File "/home/username/.local/lib/python3.7/site-packages/wandb/__init__.py", line 42, in <module> from wandb.apis import InternalApi, PublicApi, CommError File "/home/username/.local/lib/python3.7/site-packages/wandb/apis/__init__.py", line 95, in <module> from .public import Api as PublicApi File "/home/username/.local/lib/python3.7/site-packages/wandb/apis/public.py", line 21, in <module> from wandb.summary import HTTPSummary, download_h5 File "/home/username/.local/lib/python3.7/site-packages/wandb/summary.py", line 15, in <module> from wandb.meta import Meta File "/home/username/.local/lib/python3.7/site-packages/wandb/meta.py", line 6, in <module> import pynvml File "/cm/local/apps/cuda/libs/current/pynvml/pynvml.py", line 1671 print c_count.value ^ SyntaxError: Missing parentheses in call to 'print'. Did you mean print(c_count.value)? </denchmark-code>
<denchmark-h:h3>Potential fix</denchmark-h>
I skimmed the code and the repo, it seems pynvml (Python bindings for NVIDIA Management Library) is used only in meta.py and stats.py to log used GPU stats and GPU count. A possible fix would be to wrap imports with try-catch + fail flag, or maybe an environment flag to skip that part entirely. I can make a pull request over this weekend, but let me know if you have something else in mind.

comments.comment: Issue-Label Bot is automatically applying the label bug to this issue, with a confidence of 0.97. Please mark this comment with üëç or üëé to give our bot feedback! Links: <denchmark-link:https://github.com/marketplace/issue-label-bot>app homepage</denchmark-link> , <denchmark-link:https://mlbot.net/data/wandb/client>dashboard</denchmark-link> and <denchmark-link:https://github.com/hamelsmu/MLapp>code</denchmark-link> for this bot.

This is strange, it seems like you have an environment issue where your PYTHON_PATH has python2 libraries in it. Have you tried running this in a virtual environment? I'm hesitant to make our library handle this case as we haven't heard this happening anywhere else. Is there anything special about your environment?
Maybe try doing a pip3 install pynvml --upgrade and see if that fixes it.

You are right, thank you! Apparently old pynvml was in PYTHONPATH, and it was listed before site-packages. I've installed pynvml through pip, as you pointed out, and then run the script with custom PYTHONPATH where site-package is earlier than old pynvml path, and now it works OK. I will close both the issue and the associated PR, since it's a configuration problem, not the library issue.

<denchmark-link:https://github.com/aclifton314>@aclifton314</denchmark-link> <denchmark-link:https://github.com/borisdayma>@borisdayma</denchmark-link> <denchmark-link:https://github.com/vanpelt>@vanpelt</denchmark-link> hiÔºå How can I solve this problem as follows? The installed wandb can not be used normally, and other different versions of wandb have been tried. I also have try 0.9.5 version or oldest version and I have search in stackoverflow and baidu search engine. File "finetune.py", line 399, in <module> main(args) File "finetune.py", line 373, in main logger=logger, File "path/github/transformers/examples/lightning_base.py", line 380, in generic_train trainer.fit(model) File "path/miniconda3/lib/python3.7/site-packages/pytorch_lightning/trainer/trainer.py", line 1003, in fit results = self.single_gpu_train(model) File "path/miniconda3/lib/python3.7/site-packages/pytorch_lightning/trainer/distrib_parts.py", line 186, in single_gpu_train results = self.run_pretrain_routine(model) File "path/miniconda3/lib/python3.7/site-packages/pytorch_lightning/trainer/trainer.py", line 1127, in run_pretrain_routine self.logger.log_hyperparams(ref_model.hparams) File "path/miniconda3/lib/python3.7/site-packages/pytorch_lightning/utilities/distributed.py", line 12, in wrapped_fn return fn(*args, **kwargs) File "path/miniconda3/lib/python3.7/site-packages/pytorch_lightning/loggers/wandb.py", line 129, in log_hyperparams self.experiment.config.update(params, allow_val_change=True) AttributeError: 'function' object has no attribute 'update'

Hey <denchmark-link:https://github.com/Qnlp>@Qnlp</denchmark-link> this is really strange. Can you print what is after you've initialized the WandbLogger? A quick thing to try is our prerelease library. You can install with .
